events.title: Critical OpenSSL vulnerability (active exploitation) disclosed
events.summary: Multiple security outlets report a critical OpenSSL vulnerability being actively exploited in the wild, affecting web and VPN stacks worldwide. Emergency mitigations advised.

events.title: Ribbon Communications reports breach by nation-state actor
events.summary: Ribbon Communications disclosed a breach by a nation-state-level actor that accessed older customer files; implications for global telecom supply chain security.

events.title: Russia-linked group leverages LOTL to breach Ukrainian energy networks
events.summary: Analysts observe a Russia-linked intrusion set using living-off-the-land techniques and custom webshells to maintain persistence in Ukrainian power-sector networks.

events.title: Coordinated misinformation campaign detected in Baltic states
events.summary: Monitoring groups and EU disinfo trackers report a coordinated influence campaign amplifying anti-NATO narratives on social platforms in the Baltics ahead of regional political events.

events.title: DHS/CISA-like advisories flag ransomware activity relying on foreign cloud infrastructure
events.summary: US advisory-style reporting highlights ransomware gangs increasingly using foreign-based cloud services as persistent infrastructure; this raises supply-chain and allied risk.

events.title: LinkedIn-based spear-phishing campaign targets telecom executives in Europe
events.summary: Security researchers report a targeted campaign using decoy job offers and credential phishing on LinkedIn aimed at telecom leadership, potentially exposing backbone access credentials.

events.title: New malware family observed in Australian energy OT environment
events.summary: Incident responders confirm a new malware strain operating in a utility's SCADA environment; mitigations and cross-sector alerts recommended.

events.title: AI-generated phishing templates used by espionage group
events.summary: Mandiant and other threat intel firms report espionage groups using AI to produce plausible spear-phishing templates, increasing campaign automation and scale.

events.title: Fake-account network distributes influence narratives across South America
events.summary: Threat researchers uncover a network of fake social accounts amplifying narratives on sanctions and economic policy, likely state-directed influence operation.

events.title: CERT-EU advisory: ICS encryption bypass in transport sector
events.summary: CERT-EU issues mitigation guidance for a new ICS encryption bypass vulnerability affecting European transport operators.

events.title: Russian state-media amplifies NATO 'cyber provocation' narrative
events.summary: Multiple state outlets in Russia publish narratives accusing NATO of cyber provocationsâ€”part of broader hybrid messaging ahead of regional exercises.

events.title: Indian telecom operator reports Chinese-linked intrusion attempts
events.summary: Reports indicate intrusion attempts on Indian 5G network components by groups with links to Chinese espionage activity; investigation ongoing.

events.title: Norwegian CERT: elevated scanning and phishing activity targeting energy sector
events.summary: NorCERT bulletin reports elevated scanning and targeted phishing against Norwegian energy companies; operators advised to increase detection thresholds.

events.title: Leaked memo: NATO logistics hub disrupted by cyber incident
events.summary: A leaked internal memo suggests a cyber incident disrupted supply-chain operations at a NATO logistics facility; details remain classified pending formal confirmation.

events.title: GitHub trending security tool 'APT-Hunter' adopted by researchers
events.summary: New open-source IOC parsing and hunt tool trends on GitHub, accelerating community TTP-sharing and detection work.

events.title: German electronics supplier reports supply-chain compromise and data exfiltration
events.summary: Reuters reports a German company suffered a supply-chain compromise that led to data exfiltration impacting EU manufacturers; broader industry risk noted.

events.title: Recorded Future: coordinated fake-news network pushes anti-sanctions narratives
events.summary: Recorded Future reports a large-scale fake-account operation amplifying messages about sanctions and tech sovereignty in South America and Africa.

events.title: Trellix/Mandiant-style analysis: APTs using third-party cloud supply chains
events.summary: Vendor reports indicate APTs increasingly exploit third-party cloud and managed service providers to gain persistent footholds.

events.title: BankInfoSecurity: states may weaponize UN cyber treaty, analysts warn
events.summary: Analysts caution that state parties could use future international cyber agreements to legitimise restrictive digital policies; strategic implications discussed.

events.title: CVE trends: surge in disclosed vulnerabilities and exploit speed in 2025
events.summary: Research blogs and vulnerability stats show an unprecedented surge in published CVEs and faster weaponization in 2025; detection windows shrinking.

events.title: F5 and other vendor incidents underscore supply-chain software risk
events.summary: Multiple vendor incidents (F5, Oracle-linked campaigns) highlight software supply-chain exposure and propagation risk across enterprise customers.

events.title: Google/Threat Intel: active exploitation of WSUS/Windows Server vulnerability observed
events.summary: Vendor and researcher posts indicate active exploitation of a Windows Server/WSUS vulnerability; agencies recommend patching and mitigations.

events.title: Analysis: Volt Typhoon campaign prepositions capabilities against maritime comms
events.summary: Security analyses show continued reconnaissance and prepositioning by China-linked campaigns against maritime communications and logistics infrastructure.

events.title: NTIA/industry notes on cloud provider abuse by cybercriminal groups
events.summary: Industry advisories note increased abuse of cloud providers and compromised cloud admin consoles used for persistence and hosting of extortion infrastructure.
